5.16.19  11:38 pm   I've been decoding your incredible drum style. One non-hihat element has to be hitting on every downbeat, usually a kick or cowbell/block, while the rest of the drums groove. Could you disclose another secret to that magic?

     i will be putting out a pamphlet

5.16.19  9:53 pm   No reality for the 15th?

     reality videos have been on a friday upload schedule. at least for the past several weeks. that would be the 17th

5.16.19  8:33 pm   the only real reward for myself is doing more work.

     have you considered giving yourself a reward for getting a reward

5.16.19  8:10 pm   If you really understand the mechanics of music, let's say you can listen to a song once and know all the chords, what scales they fit into, the counterpoint, the modes, the timing, etc - does that add or take away from the experience? 

     it's the experience that adds to the knowledge

5.16.19  7:21 pm   How long is the new song?

     3:21

5.16.19  7:19 pm   will we be seeing any of your "new trick" in the upcoming reality video?

     no, reality videos are generally about past times

5.16.19  6:58 pm   What's a good acronym for EADBGE?

     elvis actually died by getting electrocuted

5.16.19  6:55 pm   why do you think superhero movies are so popular?

     i don't know

     I feel weird for not caring about them

     i do too sometimes. i think we all have things we just don't get

5.16.19  5:36 pm   how do i determine the key of a song i am listening to

     i'm not sure. for me it's kind of like looking at a face and determining which way is the top. can't explain it, you just know. but, i think if you delete everything except the melody you'll probably figure it out right away

5.16.19  5:16 pm   This year I finally understood creation. The whole experience is







I don't know what words to use.

     the important thing is you know. the rest of the gaps will fill in from time to time, as they please, in more ways than you might ever expect

5.16.19  5:02 pm   I absolutely love talking about language stuff, especially explaining grammar rules to people I know who are having trouble understanding the rules of a certain language at the moment. It makes me feel pretty smart!! The problem is that I sometimes make grammar mistakes myself and I absolutely hate it!!! It makes me feel like I know NOTHING about ANY language that I'm currently able to speak. Is it normal to make such mistakes? Does everyone make them? 

     i think so. especially when you account for the fact that language was founded on mistakes. wait actually the entire universe was made from mistakes, i think

5.16.19  4:45 pm   What was the Main Inspiration for your surreal videos, it's probably not like you were just s u r r e a l t i m e. If you were inspired what inspired you?

     i'm just trying to be reasonable

5.16.19  4:35 pm   5.15.19  11:35 pm - I'm sorry you feel that nobody's listening to you, believe me we're all trying very hard to. Maybe what you need to do is not release an album, but rather an ablum?

     i don't really like albums. i don't really get why they weren't either something less or something more. seems like an awkward middle ground. but that's just my taste i guess. maybe they're not right for everybody

5.16.19  3:41 pm   It occurs to me that the confusion over the idea of an 'album' is down to a lack of agreement with regards to definition. I think you take the term 'album' quite literally, almost as the term photo album, i.e. a repository for a set of only loosely connected items. Most of the people arguing in favour of a Bill Wurtz album see the album in general as a sophisticated artwork that, in its most successful cases, has not a single note or word out of place and was conceived as a thematic whole, like a novel or a movie, and not as a random selection of songs. All the great albums are apparently random selections of songs, that reveal their inner logic and consistency only gradually, sometimes after many years. Pet Sounds and Rubber Soul fall into this category. You yourself have already made one total masterpiece of an album. Its most satisfying tracklisting (for me) runs as follows:

1) Alphabet Shuffle
2) Outside
3) And The Day Goes O n
4 ) at The Airport Terminal
5) Slow Down
6) Hallelujah
7) Hello Sexy Pants
8) Mount St Helens
9) La De Da De Da De Da De Day Oh
10) Long Long Journey
11) I'm Best Friends With My Own Front Door
12) When I Get Older
13) The Moon Is Made Of Cheese

The new album is also shaping up well ( Might Quit, Just Did A Bad Thing). I'm also not overlooking Christmas Isn't Real: it is my personal favourite of all your songs, but perhaps too high-concept to integrate easily into an album.

You have lifted the single song and video package onto the level of art form almost single-handedly. Pity us older music lovers who are still attached to our 45 minute programs, preferably broken into two halves. The album was our guiding principle, our mainstay, our educator and friend. No movie or novel (or music video) could ever approximate its awesome depth and breadth of vision. Only the truly great managed to master it as an art form, most crashed inexorably on its treacherous cliffs. Indeed, if you set out to create an album as a work of art you may already have shipwrecked. Its easily the most confounding mainstream modern artistic discipline. It's a shame it is really dying. Perhaps it is already dead? 

     i am the wrong person to ask about this, because i simply never connected with that format. i also try desperately to avoid dwelling on the feeling that a certain art form is 'dying' because it just seems to abundantly clear to me that artforms are thriving and being born at each and every moment, just as enthrallingly and eagerly as they ever were

5.16.19  1:36 pm   i hear you. what do you mean by an album being too good to be called an album? like the album itself becomes known as itself rather than an 'album'?

      could be like a film or a musical stage production. or better yet, something interactive. some type of game-video (video game?), maybe an escape the room. maybe an international arms race. just throwing some ideas out there

5.16.19  12:38 pm   5.12.19  12:19 pm sorry i didn't get that

     your next incarnation is going to be different than the current. usually. i think. like very different, ... take the cartridge out ... un plug the game system ... different game system . actually forget that, go to a different house, or a different planet ... hmm. ... no, more different than that actually, is what i meant

5.16.19  12:02 pm   How do I not be tired?

     you could go to sleep and possibly dream about not being so tired

5.16.19  11:46 am   What is your opinion on reality shows?

     they seem to be at their strongest when their reality levels are somewhere around 61.8 %

5.16.19  11:33 am   how do you know what melodies to use/create them?

     you don't, but the good news is the melodies have been spying on you and they will prey upon you when you least expect

     that's always been the tough thing about making music for me :/

     sometimes they behave somewhat like an absentee father

5.16.19  11:33 am   5.15.19  11:35 pm i dont understand why that second part would be true if there have been very great albums that we still call albums

     that's fair, i think it just so happens that i don't like any albums, aside from the songs they contain. i have yet to hear one that seems to actually aquire any special quality due to the order of the songs. i've specifically gone searching for this on many occasions, i used to trust that it must be true, but after listening to so many of the most famous albums that are famous for being *great albums*, i actually have unilaterally failed to see anything special about the album as a whole, and still feels like at best it is just a bunch of really awesome songs, and on every album i've ever heard (in proper order) that i can think of, including the ones that are the most famous for being *great albums*, almost every time i still feel like at least some of the songs are in extremely the wrong order. i actually think songs probably go best in different orders on different days, unless you are able to do additional craftwork additionally going far beyond the music, to set up the songs to guarantee it's the right order. to do this i think you'd surely need at least as much connecting tissue (audio AND visual preferably) as could be found in a stage musical, at least. i don't see why you would want to do LESS than that, unless you are really just doing songs. no one seems to ever get what i'm saying on this but that's ok. i live alone

5.16.19  11:30 am   5.15.19  11:35 pm   i think it's coming across that you think all albums are bad or would be better as many singles.  if you picked examples of things which are more than albums that would help,

     a film, an amusement park, perhaps a high profile divorce settlement

      though i assume you don't want to play favorites.  maybe you could confirm that there are things which exist that you feel are "albums but more",

     not exactly 'albums but more' ... i'd just say ... 'more'

      and if you want to create such a thing

     i would love to create more things of that size, but being only 1 person i have only created maybe 1 or 2 things of that size. but i would like to do more

5.16.19  11:24 am   Would you ever be happy expressing yourself in a song with just one piano track and one vocal track?

     yes

      Or do you feel the maximalism you use is necessary to making your songs truly great?

     both are important

5.16.19  11:16 am   so i noticed that if you right click on a song or video on this website, you can loop it. wouldn't this work well for posting vines?

     i think that's browser specific, but to do the vine files properly you need to have a very specifically timed loop, certainly tighter than that, probably cutting off several frames to make it line up right, and have a sophisticated buffer system somehow so it can be sure to be timed right on all devices. this isn't that important for non-song vines, but for the ones that are musical loops (q train, letterman, etc) it's essential that the loop is clean so the beat stays in time

5.16.19  10:47 am   when is your next video

     24 hours a day it seems like at this point

5.16.19  10:34 am   This is bill wurtz's longest question.

     that's not true

      A long time go, a person was born. The person's name was bill wurtz. He learned to sing,

     not until much later

      he had a lot of instruments, more specifically, the keyboard.

     mostly drums first, and some keyboard, then gradually more keyboard, then eventually singing

      He uploads videos. He has over 250,000,000 views. He has over 3,000,000 subscribers. He answered over 40,000 questions.

     i think it's at least 100,000

      He won a strange award. He has a website. He is known for "history of the entire world, i guess." He is around 20 years old.

     hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha sure i did 'loud lenny' and 'skip's route' when i was 3

      He plays a lot of his instruments. He uses lowercase letters.

     and capital letters

      And finally, he is a person, robot, singer, human being, he can be anything he wants. What do you think of this question?

     it's ok

5.16.19  10:09 am   5.15.19  11:35 pm do you have any examples of something that exists already, that most other people might call an album, but which you would consider to be in that second category?

     no, i think most cases where people call something an album, i usually agree to call it an album. and in most of those cases the product usually feels, to me, like a list of songs, which i am tempted to break apart and play separately at will, in any order i wish

5.16.19  10:04 am   You've stated that when learning a new skill, you like to get better at it by making and releasing a bunch of extremely short projects before moving on to larger ones.

     that's not entirely in context

      I'm curious why you decided against using this approach for 3D modeling/animation, instead deciding to use it for a larger/medium project right out of the gate.

     the short projects strategy usually helps when you really have no idea what project to do. the first time i used 3D, it was for the very specific reason of using a round globe in the world history video. ever since then, i have been using little bits of 3D in almost every video. actually now that i think about it it would be very convenient to do very short projects, but from a writing and general procedural standpoint, that is no longer a necessary strategy to overcome challenges there, but nonetheless shortness is still part of my repertoire

5.16.19  8:47 am   in reality, isnt every room a bedroom? you can put your bed in any room in your house. even your closet or washroom (if its a large room or a small bed!)

     it is usually not considered a bedroom until the moment the bed enters the room

     maybe you could go to a food institution

5.16.19  5:03 am   sing me a song

     i will consider it

5.16.19  3:06 am   the whole idea of recording and producing your own music really appeals to me but the sheer amount of shit to learn and ways to do it stresses me out.
im pretty average at guitar and enjoy a lot of psych or punk guitar shit, but lacking knowledge of music writing makes it pretty hard to create a song. like yeah i can come up with maybe basic riffs or something that sounds ok in my head but i cant translate it to actually playing it, let alone coming up with an original rest of the song.
so where would i start if i wanted to get into audio production or furthering my skill and knowledge of guitar specifically?

     do you work well with others? for example, if you were taking a personality test, would you check the box that says 'works well with others'?

5.16.19  2:35 am   I miss your videos but I want u to do what you need to do ... I trust you.

     my videos still widely available online

5.16.19  1:43 am   i've quit playing piano for a long time and am now thinking about picking it up again. is it a good idea to start from hanon?

     as long as you check the label to see if it has any nuts are incompatible with, or was made in a location near to any such nuts

5.16.19  1:20 am   how tired are you of listening to your current song you're making a video for?

     actually i feel refreshed

      you must have heard it like 700 times by now.

     yes but over the past several weeks i've been only hearing it in 1 to 2 second intervals. at this point the rare times i hear it for 3 seconds or more are quite thrilling

      or can you still enjoy it? either way i know i will enjoy listening to and watching it probably 70 times at least

5.16.19  12:10 am   How can I become a human

     it's gonna look fake, but if you do something slightly different you might be able to find something much more real

5.15.19  11:35 pm   Going back through the reality vids, after japan you mentioned albums as being a category/focus you wanted to try tackling at some point. Is that something you're still considering/trying to do, or did you reconsider after recollecting yourself?

     the clear fragmentation occurs, which i feel like i keep saying but it falls on deaf ears every time. if you try to make an 'album' it will either not be good enough to matter that it's an album, or too good to be still called an album. for some reason i feel like no one has acknowledged that second part, i get only rebuttals on the first part seemingly as if they are blind to the second part. but that's ok, i have become accustomed to living in a parallel universe where no one seems to hear me

5.15.19  10:06 pm   how do i stop being so boring and uninteresting

     stop stopping being anything else

5.15.19  9:44 pm   do you think geese are the answer? if so, ducks maybe?

      they are both answers but there's way more answers

5.15.19  7:16 pm   how many planes are in "in the airport terminal"

     1, it's all the same one

5.15.19  6:54 pm   opinions on mediocrity? should it have a place in the world's vocab?

     unless you can figure out how to make something without a middle

5.15.19  5:34 pm   If I were to play a song, then what common type of chord should I play. Also, is A or G more recommended?

     A

5.15.19  5:29 pm   What inspired you to not dislike things? It's pretty rare to find. I was recently shown how powerful it is by a book of zen.

     if you dislike something it's your problem

5.15.19  5:18 pm   Hey Bill!!!!! I have to analyse two songs to do with adversity for my English homework and I will be using "just did a bad thing". I'm tired and I've been fasting the whole day. Could you give me at least three poetic devices in your song. Thanks.

     
1: not telling you the thing, within the entire first verse, despite telling you i was going to tell you. (that's called deception, it's like a bank loan where they lie to you before you sign it.)
2. fractal-duck form. this can be seen simply in the self-similar nature (even if you just look at it geometrically, pretty much.) of the 1st 8 bars of the chorus ('game' section). the word "take" is the 1st landing point, which happens at the 75% mark of the first 4 bars. then, the echo selfsimilar identical position on the 2x timescale, would be the word "change", which occurs at exactly the 75% mark of the first 8 bars.
3. having nearly the entire contents of 2 lines rhyme not only with each other, but also individually each having almost all of the words in them rhyme (bad glad, and the sad bad etc, dream/scheme lines)

5.15.19  4:40 pm   Have you ever considered releasing lead sheets/charts or full sheet music of your songs? I think that would be really dope, especially for people who want to do covers and such.

     that makes sense except the thing about charts is, they are whomever you write them for. and i wouldn't know who i was writing them for except the real answer is i wrote them for myself which is not always an entirely 100% representation of the final song, but it is oftan upwards of 88%. i would be glad to release those and i have released many of those, but i don't know if people are misconstruing them as instructions for them on how to play the entire actual thing i recorded, although they often are an accurate representation, upwards of about 88% or more, albeit scribbly and/or mumbly at best

5.15.19  4:38 pm   are potatoes seeds or not seeds?

     they are a lump but you can still plant them

5.15.19  3:57 pm   i turned 35 today, do you have any advice?

     become an expert

5.15.19  3:51 pm   Why are there two different versions of how am i spost?

     the second version was made to be more accessible to people with a busier schedule

5.15.19  3:47 pm   How many plot twists will finally be enough?

     not the number you'd expect
